com.example.shoutout.dbo

Class User

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.shoutout.dbo.User
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class User
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Outlines all the basic information for a user, not including their hashed password, which is handled by Firebase Auth.
    Since:
    April 29, 2021
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • User

        public User(java.lang.String id,
            java.lang.String avatarUri,
            java.lang.String username,
            java.lang.String email,
            java.lang.String displayName,
            java.lang.String biography,
            java.util.Date created,
            java.util.Date birthday,
            int permissionLevel,
            java.util.List<java.lang.String> following,
            java.util.List<java.lang.String> likes,
            java.util.List<java.lang.String> followers)
        Constructor that initializes all fields.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID (corresponds directly to FirebaseUser.getUid()
        avatarUri - The path of the avatar
        username - The username
        email - The email address
        displayName - The display name
        biography - The biography (may be empty)
        created - The date in which this account was created
        birthday - User's birthday (may be null)
        permissionLevel - Level of permission this user has (not used)
        following - List of user IDs that this user follows
        likes - List of post IDs that this user liked
        followers - List of user IDs that follow this user

      • User

        public User(java.lang.String id,
            java.lang.String avatarUri,
            java.lang.String username,
            java.lang.String email)
        A simpler constructor for creating a new user for registration.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID (corresponds directly to FirebaseUser.getUid()
        avatarUri - The path of the avatar
        username - The username
        email - The email address

      • User

        public User()
        Basic default constructor that doesn't explicitly initialize any fields.
